definitions.definition: the day of the week after Sunday and before Tuesday, the first day of the working week
definitions.labels: (informal or North American English)(especially North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: We'll discuss this at Monday's meeting.
We'll meet on Monday *(= next Monday)*.
We met on Monday *(= last Monday)*.
The museum is closed on Mondays *(= every Monday)*.
He was born on a Monday.
I always do yoga on a Monday *(= every Monday)*.
I went to Paris on Thursday, and came back the following Monday.
‘When did the accident happen?’ ‘It was the Monday *(= the Monday of the week we are talking about)*.’
Come back Monday week *(= a week after next Monday)*.

wordOrigin: From the Old English for ‘day of the moon’, translated from Latin lunae dies.
